wikipedia_page.main: Sir Bernard Henry Bourdillon  (1883–1948) was a British colonial administrator who was Governor of Uganda (1932–1935) and of Nigeria (1935–1943).

response: ** Sir Bernard Henry Bourdillon, Governor of Uganda (1932–1935)
** Sir Bernard Henry Bourdillon, Governor of Nigeria (1935–1940)

A thirteen-member committee began work on drafting the constitution on 22 March 1931. The acting Governor of Ceylon Bernard Henry Bourdillon provided technical expertise in its composition, however his recommendations were not all accepted. A first draft was completed on 16 June 1931.
* Bernard Henry Bourdillon (1883–1948), British colonial governor
